function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Cleaner air due to lockdowns against coronavirus","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus has different survival times on different surfaces, posing a risk of surface transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive correlation between covid-19 infection and air pollution, leading to increased morbidity","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Propagation and infection of coronavirus impacted by environmental factors such as temperature and humidity.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced human movement due to lockdowns","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Climatic data gaps due to covid-19 outbreak","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased pollution in city air and water bodies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Noise pollution affecting n100 million people in europe, leading to stress, elevated blood pressure, and other health issues.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Chronic traffic noise hazardous to birds, leading to embryo mortality and growth issues in zebra finches.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"International flights almost standing still due to lockdowns, reducing noise pollution from air traffic.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased threat to wildlife in poorer countries due to decreased economic capacity in pandemic areas, leading to difficulties in conserving endangered species and habitats.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased conflict between wildlife and urban areas due to human absence during lockdowns, leading to potential harm to both wildlife and humans.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on intermittent social lockdowns to nurture nature may disrupt human livelihoods and economic stability, especially in resource-dependent communities.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased movement of wildlife in human-dominated areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in human activity leading to wildlife encroachment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced traffic leading to lower road kill cases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased spread of contagious diseases due to human-wildlife interaction","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced focus on environmental protection and conservation","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in airborne disease transmission due to improved air quality","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction of co2 emissions due to lockdown measures","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in job losses due to lockdown and economic downturn","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of rebound in co2 emissions after lockdown is lifted","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in emissions leading to improved air quality","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of lockdown on pollution levels in major cities","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Temporary reduction in co2 and no2 emissions due to lockdown","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in no2 emissions due to decreased industrial activity and transportation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reopening of factories leading to increased no2 emissions","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Introduction of
